node.title: WA politicians told to get vaccinated by cut-off date, or face being locked out of parliament
node.description: Politicians find themselves in a similarÂ boat as ordinary West Australian workers as they, too, are warned they will be locked out of their workplace if they fail to meet a COVID-19 vaccination deadline.
node.content:
["The majority of West Australians who are not vaccinated soon will be locked out of their workplaces \u2014 and now politicians will be in a similar\u00a0boat.\u00a0", "West Australian\u00a0MPs\u00a0who do not show proof they have been fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by the end of January will be refused entry into state parliament during a lockdown.", "The McGowan government had previously announced politicians and their staffers would need to be vaccinated to attend work if there was a lockdown or similar restrictions.", "However, this is the first time they have been given a cut-off date, with\u00a0Leader of the Legislative Assembly David Templeman revealing\u00a0all Lower House MPs must present proof of double-vaccination by January 31, or face suspension.", "", "
Mr\u00a0Templeman says MPs who fail to show proof of vaccination, or a valid exemption, will be locked out of WA Parliament.\u00a0(ABC News: Eliza Laschon)
", "He gave notice to parliament that he would move the motion in order to protect the health and safety of MPs and their staff and to give effect to the Chief Health Officer's published health advice.", "The double-vaccination requirement would cover parliament house, including the Legislative Assembly chamber and the Legislative Assembly committee office.", "While the Legislative Council is not sitting this week, a similar motion is expected to be introduced there next week.", "The state\u00a0government introduced vaccine mandates last month and they will soon affect 75 per cent of the workforce, or about 1.1 million\u00a0West Australians.\u00a0", "Some West Australian\u00a0workers have chosen to give up their jobs rather than roll up their sleeves.\u00a0", "", "
The West Australians choosing to walk away from their job than be vaccinated against COVID-19
", "The\u00a0workforce has been divided\u00a0into three categories:", "
Mandate could face resistance
", "Upper House Liberal MP Nick Goiran has refused to disclose whether or not he had received the COVID-19 vaccine.", "Last month he\u00a0said he had \"a higher duty to advocate for people's right to medical history privacy\" in his role as Shadow Attorney-General.", "", "
WA Liberal MP Nick Goiran has raised privacy concerns over a jab mandate for politicians.\u00a0(ABC News: Rhiannon Shine)
", "Mr McGowan had previously sought legal advice on whether the state government could make vaccination mandatory for MPs.\u00a0", "\"The Premier's concession that he needs legal advice underscores the range of legal issues, involved including the separation of powers, the right of a duly elected MP to take their seat in parliament, the right to medical history privacy, and the obligation for public health responses to be objectively necessary and proportionate,\" Mr Goiran said.", "\"Given the known rate of vaccination in MPs is 95 per cent and could possibly already be 100 per cent, it appears the Premier is desperate to deflect from his lack of a plan beyond COVID while his hospital system is still not ready to cope when it arrives.\"", "", "
WA Liberal leader David Honey says the mandate for MPs is a \"political stunt\".(ABC News: James Carmody)
", "West Australian\u00a0Liberal Leader David Honey has said mandating vaccination for MPs was a distraction and a political stunt.", "Mr Templeman said MPs and staff who did not show proof of a first and second dose of a COVID-19\u00a0vaccine \u2014 or proof of a valid exemption \u2014 to the Legislative Assembly clerk by January 31 would not be allowed in the building during a lockdown.", "\"Unless otherwise ordered, any member who has not complied with the requirement set out in paragraph two is determined to have failed to comply with an order of the House and, therefore, is suspended from attending the chamber, parliament house and the Legislative Assembly committee office during a lockdown and similar restrictions,\" he said.", "", "
Going overseas? Here's what you need to know
", "But that could be overturned.", "\"If a member who is suspended under paragraph three provides proof of their first and second COVID-19 vaccine doses or proof of their exemption to the clerk, their exemption is immediately lifted,\" Mr Templeman said.", "The clerk of the Legislative Assembly will have to ensure all of this information remains confidential and is stored securely.\u00a0", "Information gathered must also be destroyed at the end of the parliamentary session, or at an earlier time if decided by parliament.\u00a0"]
